meanings.definition: To go down on one's knees.
meanings.sent1: I kneel to tie my shoelaces.
meanings.sent2: She likes to kneel when gardening.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to kneel to reach the toy under the couch.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden seem to kneel under the weight of the rain.
meanings.sent5: The knight had to kneel before the king to receive his honor.

meanings.definition: To be in a position where one or both knees are on the ground.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the players kneel to catch their breath.
meanings.sent2: The child had to kneel to look under the table.
meanings.sent3: The puppy likes to kneel when waiting for a treat.
meanings.sent4: The old tree seemed to kneel under the force of the storm.
meanings.sent5: The hiker had to kneel to drink water from the stream.
